Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown coloured pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is red-black in section, the exterior is covered with a brown-coloured slip and remains of six lines of Coptic text written in black ink, very worn in places, and containing an order for payment.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.147)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87665) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87665)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 185 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
